title: Job Openings  at T.O.N Corporate Services
content:
T.O.N. Legal & Corporate Services is a business management firm committed to helping our clients create sustainable businesses. Our team of experienced professionals provide effective strategies and quality services tailored to your needs. We are dedicated to helping you reach your business goals and ensure that your company is set up for success. Our approach is based on deep understanding of the local market and its regulations.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales & Admin Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time
Industry: Retail

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Sales & Admin Officer supports both the store’s sales and back-office administrative operations to ensure smooth daily functioning.


Key Responsibilities


	Attend to walk-in customers and drive physical store sales
	Track daily revenue and report to management
	Print receipts and manage sales logs (system-generated)
	Handle basic admin tasks (vendor calls, stock checks, internal documents)
	Coordinate with the inventory and fulfillment team


Requirements


	Minimum of OND in Business Admin, Marketing, or related field
	1 - 2 years of experience in retail or admin roles
	Customer-friendly, detail-oriented, and organized
	Familiarity with POS systems or sales tracking tools.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Order Fulfillment Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time
Industry: Retail

Job Summary


	Our client is a fast-growing tech retail company that offers gadgets and accessories through online and in-store channels, with a strong focus on innovation and customer satisfaction.
	This role ensures all customer orders are processed, packaged, and delivered efficiently and accurately.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor app orders and prepare items for delivery
	Ensure timely dispatch with logistics partners (GIGL, DHL, etc.)
	Handle returns, replacements, and tracking updates
	Collaborate with inventory and customer service for smooth hand-offs


Requirements


	OND / HND / Bachelor’s Degree
	Previous experience in logistics or order processing is a plus
	Good communication and coordination skills
	Must be tech-savvy and proactive.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Central Head of SPD (Spiritual Development Department)

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time
Industry: Marketing

Job Summary


	The Head of SPD will be responsible for optimizing all the opportunities for spiritual formation in the Church by nurturing and edifying the members of the congregation. The Head of SPD will also design, oversee, and administer spiritual development opportunities.
	The person will help members to grow in their faith, to grow in maturity and wisdom, and to build their faith on a strong foundation so that they can then disciple and lead others toward achieving the goal/objective of the Church


Principal Duties and Responsibilities
Spiritual Formation Program Development:


	Design and implement programs that support spiritual growth, discipleship, and theological education.
	Develop resources and curricula for Bible studies, small groups, discipleship classes, and mentoring initiatives.
	Assess and continuously improve programs to align with the Church’s vision and the needs of its members.


Mentorship & Discipleship:


	Establish and oversee mentorship and discipleship programs that connect newer members with seasoned Church members.
	Train and equip spiritual mentors and discipleship leaders to support members on their faith journeys.
	Create pathways for members to develop and deepen their spiritual gifts in line with their calling.


Worship and Prayer Initiatives:


	Collaborate with worship teams to create meaningful and engaging worship experiences.
	Develop prayer programs, such as prayer groups, prayer chains, and spiritual retreats, to deepen the prayer life of the congregation.
	Encourage participation in regular worship and prayer as part of spiritual growth.


Community Engagement & Small Groups:


	Oversee the formation and growth of small groups, fostering a culture of accountability, encouragement, and shared faith.
	Ensure that small groups are accessible, diverse, and meet the varying spiritual needs of the congregation.
	Provide ongoing support, training, and resources to small group leaders to facilitate impactful group sessions.


Spiritual Progress Measurement & Evaluation:


	Develop methods to measure spiritual growth and satisfaction with spiritual formation programs.
	Gather feedback and conduct surveys to evaluate the effectiveness of initiatives and make data-driven improvements.
	Report on spiritual progress metrics to Church leadership, including participation, engagement, and overall satisfaction.


Volunteer Recruitment & Training:


	Recruit, train, and support volunteers who assist in spiritual programs and initiatives.
	Foster a sense of purpose and belonging among volunteers, equipping them with skills to lead spiritual programs effectively.
	Recognize and celebrate volunteer contributions to enhance engagement and retention.


Theological Education & Resources:


	Provide members with access to resources that enhance theological understanding and personal Bible study.
	Host guest speakers, seminars, or workshops on relevant theological and spiritual topics.
	Ensure that all educational content aligns with the Church’s beliefs and teachings.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in theology, ministry, or a related field; Master’s preferred.
	Minimum of 8 to 10 years of  work experience in an educational/learning space or related environment.
	Additional professional qualifications will be an added advantage.
	Degree in Social Sciences/Management/Arts or any other related field.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint), Adobe Acrobat, and social media web platforms.
	Deep understanding of Christian doctrine and Church teachings.
	Experience in discipleship, spiritual mentorship, and program management.
	Strong interpersonal and leadership skills, with the ability to inspire others.

title: Job Openings at MMT Consults
content:
MMT Consults is a dynamic Human Resource Consulting and General Services firm dedicated to delivering innovative, practical, and sustainable solutions that empower organizations to achieve excellence. We partner with businesses across diverse sectors to optimize their people, processes, and performance, ensuring growth, efficiency, and long-term success.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Representative

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	The Sales Representative will be responsible for promoting and selling makeup and cosmetic products, providing excellent customer service, and supporting the overall sales performance of the store.
	The role involves engaging with customers, offering product knowledge and beauty advice, meeting sales targets, and maintaining the brand’s image in line with company standards.


Requirements


	Candidates who reside around Lekki and environs will be given top priority.
	Interested candidates must possess relevant work experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and CV to: mmtconsults@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Makeup Artist

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	The Makeup Artist will provide professional makeup application services, beauty consultations, and product recommendations to clients.
	The role involves demonstrating product usage, promoting cosmetics, and supporting sales by enhancing the customer’s shopping experience.
	The Makeup Artist serves as a brand ambassador, ensuring clients feel confident, satisfied, and encouraged to purchase products.


Requirements


	Candidates who reside around Lekki and environs will be highly prioritized.


Salary
N140,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: mmtconsults@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Male candidates are strongly advised to apply.

 

 

3.) Content Creator

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Media, or related field (preferred).
	Proven experience as a content creator, social media manager, or similar role (experience in beauty/cosmetics industry is a plus).
	Strong skills in photography, videography, editing, and graphic design (Canva, Photoshop, Premiere Pro, CapCut, etc.).
	Excellent knowledge of social media platforms, algorithms, and trends.
	Strong writing, communication, and storytelling skills.
	Creativity, innovation, and attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a fast-paced retail environment.


Salary
N140,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates who meets the recruitment requirements should send their application to: mmtconsults@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
